text: Job’s Fourth Speech Continues
“Look, my eye has seen everything;
my ear has heard and has understood it.
⸤What you\f + \fr 13:2 \ft Plural \f* know⸥,\f + \fr 13:2 \ft Literally “Like your knowledge” \f* I myself\f + \fr 13:2 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* also know—
I \add am\add* not more inferior than you.\f + \fr 13:2 \ft Plural \f*
But I would speak to Shaddai,
and I desire to argue with God.
“But\f + \fr 13:4 \ft Or “And but” \f* you\f + \fr 13:4 \ft Plural \f* ⸤whitewash with lies⸥;\f + \fr 13:4 \ft Literally “coverers of lies” \f*
all of you\f + \fr 13:4 \ft Plural \f* \add are\add* ⸤worthless healers⸥.\f + \fr 13:4 \ft Literally “healers of worthlessness” \f*
⸤O that⸥\f + \fr 13:5 \ft Literally “Who shall give” \f* you\f + \fr 13:5 \ft Plural \f* would keep completely silent,
and \add that\add* it would become wisdom for you.\f + \fr 13:5 \ft Plural \f*
Please hear my argument,
and listen attentively \add to the\add* pleadings of my lips.
“Will you\f + \fr 13:7 \ft Plural \f* speak falsely for God?
And will you\f + \fr 13:7 \ft Plural \f* speak deceitfully for him?
⸤Will you\f + \fr 13:8 \ft Plural \f* show partiality for him⸥?\f + \fr 13:8 \ft Literally “his faces will you raise” \f*
Or do you\f + \fr 13:8 \ft Plural \f* want to plead God’s case?
\add Will it be\add* well, if he examines you?\f + \fr 13:9 \ft Plural \f*
Or can you\f + \fr 13:9 \ft Plural \f* deceive him like deceiving a human being?
“Surely he will rebuke you\f + \fr 13:10 \ft Plural \f*
if ⸤you\f + \fr 13:10 \ft Plural \f* show partiality⸥\f + \fr 13:10 \ft Literally “faces you lift up” \f* in secret.
Will not his majesty terrify you,\f + \fr 13:11 \ft Plural \f*
and his dread fall upon you?\f + \fr 13:11 \ft Plural \f*
Your\f + \fr 13:12 \ft Plural \f* maxims \add are\add* proverbs of ashes;
your\f + \fr 13:12 \ft Plural \f* defenses \add are\add* defenses of clay.
“⸤Let me have silence⸥,\f + \fr 13:13 \ft Literally “Be silent away from me” \f* and I myself\f + \fr 13:13 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* will speak,
and let come over me whatever \add may\add*.
Why should I take my flesh in my teeth
and\f + \fr 13:14 \ft Hebrew “now” \f* put\f + \fr 13:14 \ft Or “should I put,” or “will I put” \f* my life in my hand?
Look,\f + \fr 13:15 \ft Or “Though” \f* \add though\add* he kill me, I will hope in\f + \fr 13:15 \ft Or “for” \f* him;
however, I will defend my ways ⸤before him⸥.\f + \fr 13:15 \ft Literally “to his faces” \f*
Moreover, this \add is\add* salvation to me,
that \add the\add* godless would not come ⸤before him⸥.\f + \fr 13:16 \ft Literally “to his faces” \f*
“Listen carefully \add to\add* my words,
and \add let\add* my exposition \add be\add* in your ears.
Please look,\f + \fr 13:18 \ft Or “Look here” \f* I have prepared \add my\add* case;
I know that I myself\f + \fr 13:18 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* will be vindicated.
Who \add is\add* he who will contend with me?
For ⸤then⸥ I would be silent, and I would pass away.
Job Argues His Case with God
“Only you\f + \fr 13:20 \ft Singular; the antecedent is God \f* must not do \add these\add* two \add things\add* to me;
then I will not hide from your face:
withdraw your\f + \fr 13:21 \ft Singular \f* hand from me,
and let not your\f + \fr 13:21 \ft Singular \f* dread terrify me.
Then\f + \fr 13:22 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* call, and I myself\f + \fr 13:22 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* will answer;
or let me speak, then\f + \fr 13:22 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* reply to me.
“⸤How many⸥\f + \fr 13:23 \ft Literally “Like what” \f* \add are\add* my iniquities and sins?
Make known to me my transgression and my sin.
Why do you\f + \fr 13:24 \ft Singular \f* hide your\f + \fr 13:24 \ft Singular \f* face
and count me as your\f + \fr 13:24 \ft Singular \f* enemy?
Will you\f + \fr 13:25 \ft Singular \f* terrify a blown leaf?
And will you\f + \fr 13:25 \ft Singular \f* pursue dry stubble?
“Indeed, you\f + \fr 13:26 \ft Singular \f* write bitter things against me,
and you\f + \fr 13:26 \ft Singular \f* make me reap the iniquities of my childhood.
And you\f + \fr 13:27 \ft Singular \f* put my feet in the block,
and you\f + \fr 13:27 \ft Singular \f* watch all my paths;
you carve \add a mark\add* on the soles of my feet.\f + \fr 13:27 \ft Or “You mark/note my footprints” \f*
And he himself \f + \fr 13:28 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f*wastes away like something rotten,
like a garment that \add the\add* moth has eaten.
